00073 
00074 const size_t PrimeCount = sizeof(Primes) / sizeof(*Primes);
00075 const size_t MaxPrime = 4099;
00076 
00077 unsigned GetClosestPrime(unsigned Value)
00078 {
00079     // 1, 2, and 3 are prime.
00080   if (Value < 4)
00081     return Value;
00082 
00083     // Make sure our starting value is odd    
00084   unsigned prime;
00085   if (Value % 2)
00086     prime = Value;
00087   else
00088     prime = Value + 1;
00089 
00090     //if the result is within our prime number table, use binary search
00091     // to find the equal or next highest prime number
00092   unsigned L, R, M;
00093   if (prime <= MaxPrime)
00094   {
00095     L = 0;
00096     R = PrimeCount - 1;
00097     while (L <= R) 
00098     {
00099       M = (L + R) / 2;
00100       if (prime == Primes[M])
00101         return prime;
00102       else if (prime < Primes[M])
00103         R = M - 1;
00104       else
00105         L = M + 1;
00106     }
00107     prime = Primes[L];
00108     return prime;
00109   }
00110 
00111 
00112     /* the result is outside our prime number table range, use the
00113        standard method for testing primality (do any of the primes up to
00114        the root of the number divide it exactly?) and continue
00115        incrementing the result by 2 until it is prime
00116     */
00117   if (prime <= MaxPrime * MaxPrime)
00118   {
00119     bool run = true;
00120     while (run)
00121     {
00122       unsigned RootN = (unsigned)std::sqrt((double)prime);
00123       unsigned DivisorIndex = 1;
00124       bool IsPrime = true;
00125       while ((DivisorIndex < PrimeCount) && (RootN > Primes[DivisorIndex]))
00126       {
00127         if ( ((prime / Primes[DivisorIndex]) * Primes[DivisorIndex]) == prime )
00128         {
00129           IsPrime = false;
00130           break;
00131         }
00132         DivisorIndex++;
00133       }
00134       if (IsPrime)
00135         return prime;
00136       
00137       prime += 2;
00138 
00139     }
00140   }
00141   return prime;
00142 }
